title: China grants two-story building to Shree Divya Deep Secondary School in Nepal
description: On October 7, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Nepal, Mr. Qiu Guohong, inaugurated a two-story building at Shree Divya Deep Secondary School, Chhoser VDC of Mustang district of Nepal, together with Mr. Subarna Kumar Bista, Chairman of the school. The building consists of one meeting hall, one science lab and one computer room. The building was granted by the Chinese Embassy in Nepal and the People’s Government of Tibet Autonomous Region of China this year.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China grants two-story building to Shree Divya Deep Secondary School in Nepal

# Description
On October 7, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Nepal, Mr. Qiu Guohong, inaugurated a two-story building at Shree Divya Deep Secondary School, Chhoser VDC of Mustang district of Nepal, together with Mr. Subarna Kumar Bista, Chairman of the school. The building consists of one meeting hall, one science lab and one computer room. The building was granted by the Chinese Embassy in Nepal and the People’s Government of Tibet Autonomous Region of China this year.
justification: Project is focused on educational infrastructure with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Construction of school building with meeting hall, science lab, and computer room

title: China donates computers to Shree Ganeshbharati Secondary School in Nepal
description: On December 3, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Nepal, Qiu Guohong, visited Kavre district on the east of Kathmandu and donated some computers to Shree Ganeshbharati Secondary School in Mahendra Jyoti VDC of the district. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.

evidence: Donation of computers to secondary school, education sector focus

title: China donates computers to Rastriya Higher Secondary School in Nepal
description: From November 19 to 21, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Nepal, Qiu Guohong, donated some computers to Nepal Rastriya Higher Secondary School in a remote village of the Rasuwa district of Nepal. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Language Council International (Hanban) donates 3 million Rs worth of books to schools in Nepal
description: In July 2010, the Chinese Language Council International (Hanban) donated more than 3 million Rs worth of books about Chinese language and culture to several primary and secondary schools in Nepal to help Nepali students learn more about China and become interested in promoting the friendship between Nepal and China.

evidence: Donation of books about Chinese language and culture to schools, educational purpose

title: China donates 10 sets of computers to Shree Kalinag Higher Secondary School in Nepal
description: In May 2010, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong visited Dolakha district in the northern part of Nepal and offered ten sets of computers to Shree Kalinag Higher Secondary School in a remote village of the district.

title: China donates 2 million Rs worth of computers and furniture to schools in Nepal
description: In April 9 2010, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong visited Ilam District of Eastern Nepal and gave some computer and furniture assistance worth 2 million Rupees to Jitpur Higher Secondary School, Janata Higher Secondary School and Bishnu Secondary School in remote villages.

title: China donates security equipment to Nepal
description: In July 2010, China agreed to donate security equipment to the police services worth 26 million RMB (3,831,135 USD) to Nepal. It appears that the grant is intended primarily to strengthen monitoring of the Tibetan community in Nepal and security along the borders with China’s Tibet Autonomous Region. In June 2013, the equipment was disbursed to Nepal. The total commitment amount is $3,831,135, and the actual disbursement amount is $4,241,228 (Updated January 2019).
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China donates security equipment to Nepal

# Description
In July 2010, China agreed to donate security equipment to the police services worth 26 million RMB (3,831,135 USD) to Nepal. It appears that the grant is intended primarily to strengthen monitoring of the Tibetan community in Nepal and security along the borders with China’s Tibet Autonomous Region. In June 2013, the equipment was disbursed to Nepal. The total commitment amount is $3,831,135, and the actual disbursement amount is $4,241,228 (Updated January 2019).
justification: Security equipment donation to government services with no clear environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Security equipment donation to Nepal police services, focus on border monitoring and community security

title: China donates computer equipment worth 150 million CFA
description: On December 13, 2010, China donated computer equipment worth 150 million XOF to Niger's election watchdog in order to help them carry out their mission following a coup in February of that year. Ambassador Xia Hung praised the donation.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China donates computer equipment worth 150 million CFA

# Description
On December 13, 2010, China donated computer equipment worth 150 million XOF to Niger's election watchdog in order to help them carry out their mission following a coup in February of that year. Ambassador Xia Hung praised the donation.
justification: Project involves donation of computer equipment to support election monitoring, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Computer equipment donation to Niger's election watchdog, no energy-related components

title: China donates emergency food aid to Niger
description: On September 28, 2010, Chinese Ambassador Xia Huang and Nigerian Prime Minister's Chief of Staff Ali Mara held a handover ceremony for China's provision of 10 million CNY worth of emergency food aid.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China donates emergency food aid to Niger

# Description
On September 28, 2010, Chinese Ambassador Xia Huang and Nigerian Prime Minister's Chief of Staff Ali Mara held a handover ceremony for China's provision of 10 million CNY worth of emergency food aid.
justification: Project is humanitarian aid with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Emergency food aid donation, social development focus

title: China donates Medicine and Medical Equipment to Niger
description: On December 10, 2010, the Chinese Ambassador to Niger and Nigerian Acting Minister of Health attended the handover ceremony of China's donation of a batch of unspecified medicines and medical equipment. The ceremony was held in Niamey.
